content.question: A penny of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is revolving at the edge of a spinning turntable of radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, as shown. The penny has a constant tangential speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, which is the maximum speed the penny can have without slipping. Which of the following is a correct expression for the coefficient of static friction, <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Î¼</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math>, between the penny and the turntable?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction v squared, over r g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction v squared, over m r g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction m v squared, over r g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction v squared, over r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>r</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction v squared, over r g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
